Detailed Description

The libop1 C API.

Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum

An enum that represents all the error codes the library can return.

Enumerator
OP1_SUCCESS 

The API call succeeded.

OP1_ERROR 

Generic error.

OP1_ARGUMENT_ERROR 

One or more arguments passed was invalid.

enum OP1_PLAYMODE

Special values to pass to op1_drum_set_playmode.

See also
op1_drum_set_playmode
Enumerator
OP1_PLAYMODE_FORWARD 

Play the sample until the key is released.

OP1_PLAYMODE_ONE_SHOT 

Play the sample once.

OP1_PLAYMODE_LOOP 

Play the sample in a loop untile the key is released.

enum OP1_PLAYBACK_DIRECTION

The direction of playback, to pass to op1_drum_set_playback_direction.

See also
op1_drum_set_playback_direction
Enumerator
OP1_PLAYBACK_FORWARD 

Play the sample forward.

OP1_PLAYBACK_REVERSE 

Play the sample in reverse.

enum OP1_VOLUME

The base volume for a sample, i.e.

a gain of 1.0.

Function Documentation

int op1_sample_load ( const char *  file_name,
audio_file **  output 
)

Load a sample from a file name.

All the file type supported by libsndfile are supported.

Parameters
file_nameA file name, has to be non-null.
outputAn opaque handle to an audio file.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_sample_load_buffer ( const uint8_t *  data,
size_t  length,
audio_file **  output 
)

Load a sample from a buffer.

All the file type supported by libsndfile are supported.

Parameters
dataA buffer containing raw audio file data.
lengthThe size of the buffer.
outputAn opaque handle to an audio file.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_sample_destroy ( audio_file *  sample)

Destroy a sample previously loaded with op1_sample_load.

See also
op1_sample_load
Parameters
sampleThe sample to destroy, has to be non-null.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_sample_get_data ( audio_file *  sample,
int16_t **  data,
size_t *  frame_count 
)

Get raw data, as a buffer of int16_t representing the mono file.

Parameters
sampleAn opaque handle to an audio file, has to be non-null.
dataA pointer to a valid int16_t*, set to the raw data.
frame_countFilled with the number of frames of this file.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_sample_get_rate ( audio_file *  sample,
int *  rate 
)

Get the sample-rate of the file.

Parameters
sampleAn opaque handle to an audio file, has to be non-null.
rateFilled with the sample-rate of this file.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_sample_get_length ( audio_file *  sample,
size_t *  frame_count 
)

Get the length, in samples, of this file.

Parameters
sampleAn opaque handle to an audio file, has to be non-null.
frame_countFilled with the length, in samples, of this file.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_init ( op1_drum **  ctx)

Initialize a new op1_drum context.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid pointer to an op1_drum.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_destroy ( op1_drum *  ctx)

Destroys an op1_drum context.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_write ( op1_drum *  ctx,
const char *  file_name 
)

Write the final audio file to disk.

If any of op1_drum_set_start_times or op1_drum_set_end_times have been called with array that are not all zeros, start and end times will be computed and will be the start and end of each sample, with exactly one sample in between.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
file_nameA string containing the file name of the file to be written.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_write_buffer ( op1_drum *  ctx,
uint8_t **  output,
size_t *  length 
)

Write the final audio file to a buffer.

If any of op1_drum_set_start_times or op1_drum_set_end_times have been called with array that are not all zeros, start and end times will be computed and will be the start and end of each sample, with exactly one sample in between.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
outputA pointer to an array containing the output data.
lengthFilled in with the length of the array.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_add_sample ( op1_drum *  ctx,
audio_file *  file 
)

Add a sample to an op1_drum context.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
fileA pointer to a valid audio_file.
See also
op1_sample_load
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_fx ( op1_drum *  ctx,
const char *  fx 
)

Set the effect to be used for this drum sample.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
fxA string containing the effect to set. Valid values are "cwo", "delay", "grid", "nitro", "phone", "punch", "spring".
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_fx_active ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  active 
)

Set wether the effect is active by default.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
active0 for inactive, anything else for active.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_fx_params ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  params[8] 
)

Set the effect parameters, as a array of 8 integers.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
paramsAn array of parameters.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_lfo ( op1_drum *  ctx,
const char *  fx 
)

Set the LFO type to be used for this drum sample.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
fxA string containing the LFO type to set. Valid values are "bend", "crank", "element", "midi", "random", "tremolo", "value".
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_lfo_active ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  active 
)

Set wether the LFO is active by default.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
active0 for inactive, anything else for active.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.

int  params[8]

paramsAn array of parameters.

int op1_drum_set_playmode ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  params[24] 
)

Set the play-mode for each samples.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
paramsAn array of parameters that have a value specified by OP1_PLAYMODE.
See also
OP1_PLAYMODE
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.

int  params[24]

ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
paramsAn array of parameters that have a value specified by OP1_PLAYBACK_DIRECTION.
See also
OP1_PLAYBACK_DIRECTION
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.

int  enveloppe[8] 
)

Set the enveloppe for this drum sample.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
enveloppeAn array of parameters.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_pitches ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  pitches[24] 
)

Set the pitches for each samples.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
pitchesAn array of parameters. OP1_PITCH_CENTER makes it so that the sample plays unmodified.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_volumes ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  volumes[24] 
)

Set the volume for each samples.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
volumesAn array of parameters. OP1_VOLUME_FLAT makes it so that the sample plays unmodified.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_start_times ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  start_times[24] 
)

Set the start time for each samples.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
start_timesAn array of start times, in frames.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
int op1_drum_set_end_times ( op1_drum *  ctx,
int  end_times[24] 
)

Set the end time for each samples.

Parameters
ctxA pointer to a valid op1_drum.
end_timesAn array of end times, in frames.
Returns
an error code in case of error, OP1_SUCCESS otherwise.
